channel.title: DJ
channel.description: Had a show at KDVS in davis (90.3) for two seasons, summer and fall of 2008. Played indie, post-rock, grunge, jazz, experimental, electro-pop, and other things that fit my fancy. The idea behind the title of the show is that I am but one person, but the show represents the zeitgeist of the generation.

item.title: IAC, WAZ (11/17/08): A Little Prop 8 Consolation
item.description:
In the aftermath of the election of Barack Obama, many liberal activists are now confused and feel like they have lost their sense of purpose.  Fortunately for them, prop 8 passed, so they can still fight for their freedoms!
I'll be lining up a whole set of Gay related songs to console their hearts, heal their wounds, and fight the man!
 Direct Show Link
Show Description/Playlist
Bonus Track, I didn't think I should play this on air:
Norm McDonald - The World's First Two Gay Guys














































New Adds:
Team Genius - Team Genius

Happy Listening, DJ Recalcitrant id/ Ben

item.title: IAC, WAZ 11/10/08: The Obama/ Halloween Special
item.description:
Remix to start, as usual.  Then a belated Obama/Halloween celebratory set.  After that I mellow it out a bit and bring your some hip tunes.  SQUAREPUSHER TOWARDS THE END BRINGS OUT MY ID! AHHH!! YESSSSS!!!
Direct Show Link 
Show Description/Playlist











































New Adds:
Deerhoof - Offend Maggie - Kill Rock Stars 
Squarepusher - Just a Souvenir - Warp 
Obi Best - Capades - Social Science 
Of Montreal - Skeletal Lamping - Polyvinyl 
Happy Listening, DJ Recalcitrant id/ Ben

item.title: Live in Studio A: Freedom and the Tall Cans
item.description:
Freedom and the Tall Cans - are David Wilcox, Tim Mercer, Jarred Wright, and Freedom Glory: "local mountains kids that got bored". 
Show Direct Link

Bluegrass that they say draws a large audience from kids and old people, despite the fact that they in no way intended that to be their demographic.  The music kind of speaks for itself, and I can see how little kids would enjoy it.  But these guys were super chill, I'm pretty sure a couple of them were high and apparently they asked if they could drink in the studio at some point, but overall I'd say it helped their music.
(Click on photos for larger)  
...more photos
Live in Studio A Photos
Happy Listening DJ Recalcitrant id/ Ben

item.title: I Am Cell, We Are Zeitgeist: 11/3/08
item.description:
Show Description/ Playlist
KILLER, KILLER show.  This is one I actually put some time in to find some good stuff for 'yall, so give it a listen!
Show Direct Link (right click to download)

item.title: Live in Studio A: Jakob Martin
item.description:
Jakob Martin "Currently one of the fastest growing underground artists on the West Coast, Martin is best known for his raw musical style and lyrical mastery. Martin engages audiences with music, poetry, humor, and personal stories from his two years touring the United States, where he has performed over 500 concerts. In a time of dramatic change in the world, Jakob Martin’s work is relevant, stimulating, edgy, witty, and emotionally stirring, and is unlike anything you will get anywhere else.
 Show Direct Link
This guy was super chill, came in playin his mellow ass acoustic music, and even brought his own fan base of his brother, who played guest harmonica for the first time, and friends, who happened to be super cute hipster/hippie girls, one of which was wearing an obama shirt! +1 San Diego! Jakob was hella nice, and gave me his cd, which I played on my show, if you noticed. Oh yeah, and his hands were so soft when I shook them that I almost asked him if he moisturizes.
Photos  
Happy Listening, DJ Recalcitrant id/ Ben
